BREAST-COMPOSITION: predominantly fibroglandular breast parenchyma with areas of fatty tissue (ACR B).
FINDINGS: A small, well-defined irregular opacity seen in the upper outer quadrant of the breast suggests a low-suspicion malignant lesion (BIRADS 4A). No significant calcifications or other abnormalities noted. Skin and nipple appear normal. Pectoral muscle appears intact. No axillary adenopathy observed.
